metadata.title: IHC seeks progress report about eradication of drugs at educational institutions

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Sep 09 (APP): The Islamabad High Court (IHC) on Tuesday instructed the Interior Ministry, and capital police to submit progress report from January to September of current year, regarding eradication of drugs from educationalA institutions. The court remarked that childrenas lunch boxes will have to be checked to see if anything is coming fromA outside. Justice Raja Inaam Ameen Minhas heard the case of a private organization, Lucky Foundation against drugsA use at educational institutions. The police presented a report from January to April 22, 2025 in the court, according to which 255 kilogramsA of heroin and 126 kilograms of hashish were recovered from different areas of Islamabad. It also registeredA 689 cases and 709 accused were arrested. Interior Ministry officials said that an awareness campaign had also been launched in schools following theA court order. Justice Inaam remarked that awareness alone will not do anything, but effective monitoring was alsoA necessary. Childrenas lunch boxes will also have to be checked so that nothing was brought in from outside. The court said that the slogan issued by the police against drugs was not enough, and practical steps willA have to be taken. The court ruled that it was the responsibility of SHOs to monitor their area, not to initiate action only afterA a writ is filed. The lawyer of the private schoolsa organization told the court that the organization has alsoA issued directions to eradicate drugs. Later, further hearing of the case was adjourned for two weeks.
